location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith, Resident at Bushire to John Elphinston, Accountant General, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage. As a result, a hole in the folio partially obscures the address and some of the body of the letter, which makes some of the text difficult to read. However, it is still possible to identify the intended recipient.

mods.abstract: The letter is an acknowledgement of the receipt of a letter of May 1807 (the precise date is obscured). The Resident also encloses the quick and dead stocks (not present) for January-April 1807.
